page.title: 02PENN WOODS IN HOLMER GREEN
page.content: Penn Woods forms part of the green belt ,and is the largest wood in this area, being about 2 km squared.It is situated to the south east of Holmer Green village of the A404.It is not a planned wood.In places the trees grow close together and thus some are bent in one direction.In other places the trees are spaced apart and let a lot of sunlight through.The main species of decidous trees are Beech,Birch and Oak.Most of the trees are fully grown,but there are seedlings and young trees under many of the larger trees.The wood has plantations of young evergreens and groves of rhododendrons.There are a few marshes.Some of these are quite deep.They sometimes look just like grass,but they smell horrible.They disappear in warm ,dry weather.
